poem:
**Surgery on the Small Screen**

In Edinburgh's quiet rooms,  
a pancreas is unbound,  
and all the while,  
the camera lens leans closer,  
a curious eye, unblinking,  
capturing the dance of scalpel and light.  
Here, beneath the glowing bulbs,  
life is a theater so real,  
even its actors tremble,  
aware the audience holds its breath.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. We’re in Edinburgh this time, where 21-year-old law student Sania has an inflamed pancreas and needs an auto-transplant – which involves removing it and reconstructing her". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
